item.title: Report E-2025030257
item.description:
Report E-2025030257

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-25T18:19:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-28
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental-LTL was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, they observed an estimated five to six (5-6) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon plastic drum that was punctured by a forklift. First Call Environmental-LTL personnel observed that the released material impacted 15 ft-by-10 ft of trailer floor and asphalt. First Call Environmental-LTL personnel deployed a neutralizer and granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized them into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The drums also contained PPE, debris, and boom. The punctured drum was placed into a metal drum by the terminal, but due to the corrosive nature First Call Environmental-LTL placed the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon plastic drum. Generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The waste generated will remain onsite for the ESTES team to coordinate disposal

The screw caps on all eight jerrycans were loose causing a release. The jerrycans were placed into steel slavage packages and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025030798
item.description:
Report X-2025030798

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained two metal paint cans with positive closure rings both rings were damaged. One can the lid opened up and spilled all of its contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025030797
item.description:
Report X-2025030797

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-04
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a damaged fiberboard box was discovered. The fiberboard box contained thirteen metal canisters packaged with plastic molds and Styrofoam padding. One of the canisters discharged its contents the other twelve were intact. the shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
